definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

definition: bullet train/Shinkansen 新幹線|新干线, Japanese high-speed train

sentences.english: Jack subdues the suspect but realizes Hampton has been shot.
sentences.chinese: 杰克制服了嫌犯，但他发现杰西被子弹击中了。

sentences.english: I hope I don't need it, because I don't even know how to load it.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我并不需要它，因为我还不知道怎么装子弹呢。

sentences.english: A sculpture at the Detroit Zoo composed of Bullets and Gold Leaf.
sentences.chinese: 雕塑在底特律动物园组成的子弹和金叶。

sentences.english: Bullets hit people , there is a machine gun into the thick meat flu.
sentences.chinese: 子弹打在人身上，有一种枪枪入肉的厚重感。

sentences.english: My favorite is probably the bullet-time rig used in The Matrix.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的可能是黑客帝国中的子弹时刻了。

sentences.english: The hypocenter and Atom Bomb Dome are visible at top center.
sentences.chinese: 在震源和原子弹圆顶可见顶部中心。

sentences.english: This kind of machine is suitable for thermoforming fabric cups by bullet head moulds.
sentences.chinese: 该机适用于各种布料，子弹头模具的热压定型。

sentences.english: Bullets cut through his jacket; one cut off half his right ear.
sentences.chinese: 子弹扯开中尉夹克，有一发削掉中尉半只右耳。

sentences.english: I entertained myself flicking wheat-based projectiles at the cat.
sentences.chinese: 我把小面团当成子弹弹向那只猫，以此来打发时间。

sentences.english: Yet the enemys bullets hit the calf on the shi lei.
sentences.chinese: 然而敌人的子弹还是击中了石磊的小腿。

sentences.english: Several bullets struck the log-house, but not one entered;
sentences.chinese: 有几发子弹打中了木屋子，但是没有穿透进来。

sentences.english: Load up on guns and, Bring your friends.
sentences.chinese: 把枪装上子弹，带上你的朋友。

sentences.english: To get a pulse, I put my finger in a bullet hole.
sentences.chinese: 我把手指摁在子弹孔上，还有一丝脉搏的迹象。

sentences.english: The Sakhnin fans will say it was a plastic bullet.
sentences.chinese: 萨克宁哈普洱队的球迷会说这是一个橡皮子弹所为。

sentences.english: Fortunately, there are two bullet casings, know who took part in target practice.
sentences.chinese: 还好，有两个子弹壳，知道自己曾经参加过打靶。

sentences.english: "I saw bullets hit people's bodies, " Sheehan said.
sentences.chinese: “我看到子弹打到人身上，”史翰说。

definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
